intro: Cephalaria galpiniana subsp. galpiniana, commonly known as the Galpin's cephalaria, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its tall, branched stems and showy yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments. Its foliage consists of narrow, lance-shaped leaves, and it is often found in mountainous regions. This subspecies is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and ecological adaptations.
